title.narrative: FLC / MCA Development through Design and Market Access

description.narrative: Mumwa Crafts Association (MCA) is a long-term partner organization of Embassy of Finland. MCA supports local communities in Western Zambia in generating sustainable income through development of traditional craft production.In the project new craft product s (e.g. baskets) are designed together with Nordic designers. Local natural materials are used in the new products and the Nordic designers train the Zambian craft makers how to make these new products in uniform quality. MCA sells and markets the crafts t o national and international markets and the marketing capacity of MCA is developed further in the project. Most of the profits from the sales are channeled to the local crafts makers but a part is used for MCAs community development activities. MCAs partn er in the marketing activities is a local design company Nzito Furniture for example on the marketing trips to Finland and South Africa.The project creates jobs and possibilities for income generation in the countryside. It increases national and internati onal trade and through that strengthens the Zambian economy. 80% of the beneficiaries are women and 20 % marginalized men. In the project also encourages the use of local natural materials.
